greenmirror.client.modelinitializers

Class GreenMirrorGroovyBaseScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • groovy.lang.GroovyObjectSupport
      • groovy.lang.Script
        • greenmirror.client.modelinitializers.GreenMirrorGroovyBaseScript
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    groovy.lang.GroovyObject

    public class GreenMirrorGroovyBaseScript
extends groovy.lang.Script
    The base class available for the Groovy model initializer. All public methods are available in any Groovy script that has this class as its base class.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Client controller
      the controller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GreenMirrorGroovyBaseScript(@NonNull groovy.lang.Binding binding)
      Groovy creates the new instance of this base class and passes the controller through a Binding.

      • getController

        private Client getController()

        the controller

      • initialize

        public void initialize(double width,
                       double height)
        Initializes the visualizer with only the width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas
        height - the height of the canvas
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width and/or height are zero or negative

      • initialize

        public void initialize(double width,
                       double height,
                       double duration)
        Initializes the visualizer with a default animation duration set.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas
        height - the height of the canvas
        duration - the default duration for animations (in milliseconds); see SetAnimationDurationCommand for details
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width and/or height are zero or negative, or if the duration is invalid

      • initialize

        public void initialize(double width,
                       double height,
                       boolean rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly)
        Initializes the visualizer with the rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly setting (see InitializationCommand).
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas
        height - the height of the canvas
        rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly - see InitializationCommand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width and/or height are zero or negative
        See Also:
        InitializationCommand

      • initialize

        public void initialize(double width,
                       double height,
                       double duration,
                       boolean rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly)
        Initializes the visualizer with both the default animation duration and the rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly setting set (see InitializationCommand).
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas
        height - the height of the canvas
        duration - the default duration for animations (in milliseconds); see SetAnimationDurationCommand for details
        rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly - see InitializationCommand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width and/or height are zero or negative, or if the duration is invalid
        See Also:
        InitializationCommand, SetAnimationDurationCommand

      • nodes

        public @NonNull NodeList nodes()
        Returns:
        (a copy of) the list of Nodes on the visualizer

      • nodes

        public @NonNull NodeList nodes(@NonNull java.lang.String identifier)
        Gets a list of Nodes on the visualizer with a specific identifier.
        Parameters:
        identifier - see Node.Identifier#Identifier(String)
        Returns:
        a list in which every Node corresponds to identifier

      • node

        public Node node(@NonNull java.lang.String identifier)

        Parameters:
        identifier - see Node.Identifier#Identifier(String)
        Returns:
        the Node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the node was not found

      • addNode

        public @NonNull Node addNode(java.lang.String identifier)
        Adds a node with identifier to the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the node. See Node.Identifier#Identifier(String)
        Returns:
        the newly created (and added) Node

      • addNodes

        public void addNodes(Node... nodes)
        Adds as many nodes as are passed, in one statement.
        Parameters:
        nodes - an array of Nodes

      • addRelation

        public void addRelation(@NonNull Relation relation)
        Adds a Relation to the controller and the visualizer. If it's a placement relation and the node A already has a placement relation, it gets overwritten.
        Parameters:
        relation - the relation to add

      • addRelations

        public void addRelations(Relation... relations)
        Adds multiple Relations.
        Parameters:
        relations - the relations to add
        See Also:
        addRelation(Relation)

      • switchPlacementRelation

        public void switchPlacementRelation(@NonNull Relation newRelation)
        This is a synonym of addRelation(Relation), because addRelation(Relation) replaces the placement relation if the passed relation also is a placement relation.
        Parameters:
        newRelation - the new relation
        See Also:
        addRelation(Relation)

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(@NonNull java.lang.String transitionRegex,
                          @NonNull groovy.lang.Closure<java.lang.Object> code)
        Adds to the list of possible state-transitions a new transition with a default animation duration and a false supplemental setting. See addTransition(String, double, boolean, Closure).
        Parameters:
        transitionRegex - the (regex) string that indicates the transition labels it should match
        code - the code that will be executed when the transition executes
        See Also:
        addTransition(String, double, boolean, Closure)

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(@NonNull java.lang.String transitionRegex,
                          double duration,
                          @NonNull groovy.lang.Closure<java.lang.Object> code)
        Adds to the list of possible state-transitions a new transition with an animation duration and a false supplemental setting. See addTransition(String, double, boolean, Closure).
        Parameters:
        transitionRegex - the (regex) string that indicates the transition labels it should match
        duration - see SetAnimationDurationCommand
        code - the code that will be executed when the transition executes
        See Also:
        addTransition(String, double, boolean, Closure)

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(@NonNull java.lang.String transitionRegex,
                          double duration,
                          boolean supplemental,
                          @NonNull groovy.lang.Closure<java.lang.Object> code)
        Adds to the list of possible state-transitions a new transition with an animation duration and a supplemental setting.
        Parameters:
        transitionRegex - the (regex) string that indicates the transition labels it should match
        duration - see SetAnimationDurationCommand
        supplemental - whether this transition is supplemental to a previous or next one. If so, the controller won't send an EndTransitionCommand after this transition finishes
        code - the code that will be executed when the transition executes
        See Also:
        addTransition(String, double, boolean, Closure), ModelTransition

      • setAnimationDuration

        public void setAnimationDuration(double duration)
        Sets the duration of all single (upcoming) animations. This means that when flush() is used, the total duration is doubled. If -1 is passed, the duration is set to the default value. See SetAnimationDurationCommand for details on the default value.
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration in milliseconds; -1 to set it to default; 0 if you don't want the animation to play at all
        See Also:
        SetAnimationDurationCommand

      • fx

        public @NonNull FxWrapper fx(@NonNull java.lang.String type)
        Creates a new FxWrapper.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the FxWrapper instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type was invalid

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes the animations: all upcoming animations will be animated after the previous ones (and not in parallel, as is the default) without delay.

      • flush

        public void flush(double delay)
        Flushes the animations: all upcoming animations will be animated after the previous ones (and not in parallel, as is the default). Also, a delay is added after the previous animations.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay in miliseconds

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(@NonNull Node node)
        Removes a Node from the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to remove

      • removeNodes

        public void removeNodes(@NonNull NodeList nodeList)
        Removes all Nodes on nodeList from the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        nodeList - the nodes that will be removed

      • removeNodes

        public void removeNodes(Node... nodes)
        Removes all passed Nodes from the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the nodess that will be removed

      • removeRelation

        public void removeRelation(Relation relation)
        Removes a Relation from the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        relation - the relation; if null is passed, nothing happens

      • removeRelations

        public void removeRelations(Relation... relations)
        Removes all passed Relations from the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        relations - the relations to remove

      • removeRelations

        public void removeRelations(RelationList relations)
        Removes all passed Relations from the visualizer.
        Parameters:
        relations - the relations to remove

      • sendStateToLog

        public void sendStateToLog()
        Sends all node and relation data to the log. Used for debugging.

      • fail

        public void fail()
        Lets the script fail by throwing an IllegalStateException.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - because that's the purpose of this method

      • fail

        public void fail(java.lang.String msg)
        Let the script fail by throwing an IllegalStateException with a message.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message indicating why the script failed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - because that's the purpose of this method
